pageTitle: 5 CFR 1201.83 - Serving subpoenas. | US Law | LII / Legal Information Institute
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {49589=Title 5 published on 2015-01-01, 48757=§ 1204 - Powers and functions of the Merit Systems Protection Board, 49678=The following are ALL rules, proposed rules, and notices (chronologically) published in the Federal Register relating to 5 CFR Part 1201 after this date., 48885=§ 1305 - Administrative law judges, 14471=The Merit Systems Protection Board (MSPB or the Board) published an interim final rule in the Federal Register on August 19, 2014, amending its rules of practice and procedure to adapt the Board's regulations to legislative changes that have created new laws applicable to the removal or transfer of Senior Executive Service employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs. This document corrects the interim final rule by revising these sections.}
textBeforeTable: Additional Documents GPO FDSys XML | Text 80 FR 21153 - Practices and Procedures 2015-04-17; vol. 80 # 74 - Friday, April 17, 2015 For a complete list of all Rules, Proposed Rules, and Notices view the Rulemaking tab. The following are only the Rules published in the Federal Register after the published date of Title 5. Title 5 published on . A subpoena directed to an individual outside the territorial jurisdiction of any court of the United States may be served in the manner described by the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure for service of a subpoena in a foreign country. (b) Any person who is at least 18 years of age and who is not a party to the appeal may serve a subpoena. The means prescribed by applicable state law are sufficient. The party who requested the subpoena, and to whom the subpoena has been issued, is responsible for serving the subpoena.
textAfterTable: MERIT SYSTEMS PROTECTION BOARD Final rule. Effective April 17, 2015. 5 CFR Part 1201 Summary The Merit Systems Protection Board (MSPB or the Board) hereby amends its rules of practice and procedure in order to correct a minor drafting error in the Board's regulations. 2015-01-28; vol. 80 # 18 - Wednesday, January 28, 2015 80 FR 4489 - Practices and Procedures GPO FDSys XML | Text Additional Documents type regulations.gov FR Doc. 2015-01575 RIN MERIT SYSTEMS PROTECTION BOARD Final rule. Effective March 30, 2015, and applicable in any appeal filed on or after March 30, 2015. 5 CFR Part 1201
